recipes.name: Lamb Shank Pie

ingredients.item: Juice and grated rind of 1 lemon

method: Dust the shanks in flour and brown them in butter and oil in a heavy skillet.
Put the shanks in a saucepan, cover with water, wine, and tomato paste, and cook gently for about 90 minutes.
Sauté the vegetables with garlic in the same frying pan.
Add the tomatoes, lemon juice, and rind. Cook gently for another few minutes.
Transfer the lamb shanks into a casserole dish, add the vegetables, and spoon mashed potatoes on top.
Finish cooking in a preheated 190°C oven for 30 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Fluffy Pikelets
method: Sift flour, salt, and baking soda into a bowl.
Add sugar, egg, and milk. Beat on low speed until mixed.
Fold in melted butter. Place spoonfuls of the mixture onto a hot griddle or frypan.

recipes.name: Barbadian Cake
method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease and flour a 9 or 10 inch bundt pan.
Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat well.
Sift flour and baking powder together. Add to butter mixture with 1 cup of milk. Beat well.
Add remaining milk, vanilla, and almond extracts. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake at 400°F for 1 hour, then reduce heat to 350°F and bake for another 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Waterzooi A La Gantoise
method: Cut the chicken into four pieces and place in a pot with the stew beef. Cover with water and bring to a boil.
Skim the foam, add onions, celery, leeks, carrot, and salt. Simmer for 2 hours.
Remove the beef, skin, and bones from the chicken. Strain the cooking liquid and reduce it to about 1 quart.
Beat the egg yolks with half and half and pepper. Stir in cooking liquid and lemon juice.
Add the chicken pieces and heat through. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Palta Rellenos
method: If using frozen shrimp, thaw completely. Cut avocados in half and remove the stones.
Use a melon baller to scoop out the avocado flesh. Reserve skins and 4 avocado balls.
Dice the remaining avocado and banana. Sprinkle with lemon juice.
Combine mayonnaise, half and half, salt, sugar, pepper, and paprika.
Fold in the banana mixture, chicken, and lettuce.
Spoon the mixture into the reserved avocado skins and top with shrimp and avocado balls.

recipes.name: Tarator
method: In a blender, puree cucumber and garlic.
Add the dill, salt, water, and yogurt and mix well.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
When ready to serve, ladle into bowls and sprinkle with toasted almonds.
